page.title: 01Chinley - a general picture
page.content: This block is bounded on the West by the village of Chinley, whose once vast railway station now shows only a vestige of its former glory,attested by the now incongruous presence of a large railway hotel,the Prince's. Hill farming is now the chief industry though three textile-finishing mills adorn the banks of the Black Brook and to the SE lies the sprawling Ferodo complex, home of motor car brake linings. The theme of Transport,old and new, dominates the valley,from the remnants of the 18th C Tramway to the massive double railway viaducts at Chapel Milton and the brown scar of by-pass workings. Even so,the area is still almost pure "country",a happy mix of old and new, local farmer and commuting executive living cheek by jowl.
